titleStmt.title: Nicholas Thorne versus John Goodrich, executor of the last will and testament of Robert Thorne the elder. Replication by Nicholas Thorne to the answer of John Goodrich. 1533 - 1538

abstract.p: Replication by Nicholas Thorne to the answer of John Goodrich.

div.p:
The Replicacion of Nicholas Thorn
to thaunswer of John Gooderidge

The said Nicholas Thorn sayth that hys sayd byll of Compleynt ys trewe certeyn sufficient in the lawe not faymed ymagyned nor devysed to any suche intent or purpose as in the sayd Awnswer ys supposid
And farder ?anereth every thynge in the sayd bill of Compleynt conteyned to be trewe wtowtewithowte that that Richard Robert Thorn late ffather unto the sayd compleynant made the sayd defendant William Wolsley and John
Wyett Executors of his last wyll and testament whiche yf he dyd hyt ys nothyng materiell forasmoche as the sayd William Wolsley and John Wyett be ded and the hole ?ynterstand
?tytle of the sayd Testement and last wyll remayneth in the said defendant Or that the sayd defenduant and the other supposed Executors Accordynge to the trust and confidence put
in them by the sayd Testator delte or delyveryd unto pore peple and prisonners wtynwithin the sayd Town of Bristowe by the space of iiij yeres nexte after the dethe of the sayd testator
yerely xxxij s as by the sayd defendant ys alledged or that the landes and tenementes specefied in the sayd byll of Compleynt lying in the sayd Town of Brystowe and supposed
to be boght wtwith parte of the Som of lxxx li mencioned in the sa[yd] ... were or be but of the yerely value of xxxij s ffor the sayd compleynant sayth that hyt ys not to be
supposed that the sayd defendant wold have geven so moche money as ys recited yn thesayd Awnswer for so lytle land or that the sayd tenementes at the tyme said p>urchyse
were yn suche Rewen and dekeye as ys specefyed in the sayd Awnswer / Or that the sayd defenduant hath spent or bestowed any grett somme of money of his own goodes upon the
repayryng and Amendyng the same Or that the sayd Tenementes and land so purchaysed be yerely worth butt iiij li as ys by the sayd defenduant alledged ffor thesayd
defenduant sayth that the sayd tenementes and land before rehersed be yerely worth vj li ortheraboute / Or that the sayd Robert Thorn the Son was at the tyme of the deth
of the sayd Robert the ffather yndettyd unto hys ffather yn the som of CC l poundez sterling as is supposed in the sayd Awnswer / Or that the sayd Robert the Son reteyned yn
his handes any suche som of money due to hys sayd ffather as ys specefyd in the sayd AwnswrAwnswer / Or that the sayd Compleynant was bounden by his dede Obligaton
unto the sayd defenduant and John Wyett for the paymet of the Som of CC l poundes in manner and form as in the said Awnswer ys expressed ffor the sayd defenduant sayth
that hyt appereth by dede yndentyd made betwene the sayd Compleynant and the sayd defenduant and John Wyett for what yntent the sayd bond was made / Or that the
sayd defenduant made any suche graunt of xl s to be goyng owte of the hospytall of saynt Bartholomes and the landes and tenemenes ther unto belongyng specefyed yn
thesayd Awnswer for the Contynuell ffyndyng of the pore peple in the sayd hosytall and of a Scoole master to teache and lern Chylder in the trewe Arte of Gramer
ther yn manner and form as in the sayd Awnswerys alledged / Or that the sayd Compleynant hath made any suche reporte that he wyll have no pore peple yn the
sayd Hospytall for suche as lacke ther as ys recyted yn the sayd AwnswrAwnswer Whiche yf he had don hyt were nothynge effectuell nor materyell by cause the Agrement
had betwen the sayd Compleynant and the sayd defenduant was ony for thestablishementt and Contynuance of a ffree Scoole at the sayd hospytall and for non other yntent
nor purpose Or that the lackyng of a Scoole master for to teache Grammer yn the sayd Hospytall ys in defaute of the sayd Compleynant ffor the sayd Complaynant sayth
that yf the sayd defenduant wold perform hys covenant graunt promyse and Agrement had and made wtwith the sayd Compleynant and make good and syffyient
assurances in the lawe of the landes and tenementes specefyed in the sayd byll for thestablishement and contynuaunce of the sayd Scoole the sayd Scoole
shold be establyshed and in all thynges as hyt oght to be whiche Remeyneth undon in the defaute of the sayd defenduant for that the sayd Scoole can not
in all thynges be meynteyned as hyt oght to be wtowtewithowte the Rentes and profettes of the sayd landes wtwith holdyn by the sayd defenduant / Or that the
sayd defenduant or any other by reason of any Extremyte or Uncharytable delyng of the sayd Complynant have cause to wtwith drawe ther devosyons or benevolence / Or that the
said defenduant hath layde owte admynystred &and bestowed in &and aboute the severall dettes legaces or other Chartitable dedes for Þethe said testator more money then ever came to his handes of Þethe goodes of the said testator And wyth
owte that any other thynge effectuell or materiell in the sayd AwnswrAwnswer alledged and not here suffyciently ?confessed and avoyded denyed nor traversed ys trewe All whiche matters he ys redy to
Answere as this Court wyll Award And prayth as he in his sayd byll of Compleynt hathe prayd wtwith his costes and Charges by hym Sustyeyned yn this behalff
